intro: Phyteuma spicatum subsp. alpestre, commonly known as the alpine phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils at high altitudes. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays.
